lead_paragraph: Mr. Rubio’s conspicuously manly talk has come as his Republican opponents have tried to infantilize or even feminize him.

byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters reported from Waverly, and Michael Barbaro from New York.
byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and MICHAEL BARBARO

headline.print_headline: Boots? Rubio Wants to Talk Guns and Football
headline.main: Boots? Marco Rubio Wants to Talk Guns and Football

snippet: Mr. Rubio’s conspicuously manly talk has come as his Republican opponents have tried to infantilize or even feminize him.
abstract: Republican presidential hopeful Marco Rubio puts great emphasis on his masculine interests even as rivals try to infantilize or even feminize him; has been criticized most harshly by New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, who speculated recently that Rubio would get taken down by Hillary Rodham Clinton in general election.
